segment.source: WinPE: Add drivers
segment.target: WinPE: Add drivers

segment.source: WinPE: Add drivers
segment.target: WinPE: Add drivers

segment.source: WinPE: Add drivers
segment.target: WinPE: Add drivers

segment.source: Add drivers to Windows PE, such as graphics drivers or network drivers.
segment.target: Add drivers to Windows PE, such as graphics drivers or network drivers.

segment.source: Device drivers typically include a folder that contains multiple files.
segment.target: Device drivers typically include a folder that contains multiple files.

segment.source: These folders include a file that has the file name extension.
segment.target: These folders include a file that has the file name extension.

segment.source: This file manages the other files in the device driver package.
segment.target: This file manages the other files in the device driver package.

segment.source: Many boot-critical drivers can be used in both the Windows image and in Windows PE.
segment.target: Many boot-critical drivers can be used in both the Windows image and in Windows PE.

segment.source: You can also update device drivers while you're running Windows PE.
segment.target: You can also update device drivers while you're running Windows PE.

segment.source: For more information, see Drvload Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see Drvload Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Get the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit with Windows PE tools
segment.target: Get the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit with Windows PE tools

segment.source: Install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) Technical Reference, including the Windows PE feature.
segment.target: Install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) Technical Reference, including the Windows PE feature.

segment.source: Create a set of either 32-bit or 64-bit Windows PE files
segment.target: Create a set of either 32-bit or 64-bit Windows PE files

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: In the Deployment Tools and Imaging Environment, copy the Windows PE files for the PCs you want to boot.
segment.target: In the Deployment Tools and Imaging Environment, copy the Windows PE files for the PCs you want to boot.

segment.source: The 64-bit version can boot 64-bit UEFI and 64-bit BIOS PCs.
segment.target: The 64-bit version can boot 64-bit UEFI and 64-bit BIOS PCs.

segment.source: The 32-bit version can boot 32-bit UEFI, 32-bit BIOS, and 64-bit BIOS PCs.
segment.target: The 32-bit version can boot 32-bit UEFI, 32-bit BIOS, and 64-bit BIOS PCs.

segment.source: Mount the Windows PE boot image
segment.target: Mount the Windows PE boot image

segment.source: Mount the Windows PE image.
segment.target: Mount the Windows PE image.

segment.source: Add customizations
segment.target: Add customizations

segment.source: Add device drivers (.inf files)
segment.target: Add device drivers (.inf files)

segment.source: Add the device driver to the Windows PE image.
segment.target: Add the device driver to the Windows PE image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Although you can add multiple drivers to an image by using one command, it is often easier to troubleshoot problems by adding each driver package individually.
segment.target: Although you can add multiple drivers to an image by using one command, it is often easier to troubleshoot problems by adding each driver package individually.

segment.source: Verify that the driver packages are part of the image:
segment.target: Verify that the driver packages are part of the image:

segment.source: Review the resulting list of drivers and verify that the list contains the driver package that you added.
segment.target: Review the resulting list of drivers and verify that the list contains the driver package that you added.

segment.source: Video drivers: Change the display resolution
segment.target: Video drivers: Change the display resolution

segment.source: For most graphics drivers, WinPE picks the maximum native resolution automatically.
segment.target: For most graphics drivers, WinPE picks the maximum native resolution automatically.

segment.source: To manually adjust the size, use an answer file and include settings for Microsoft-Windows-Setup/Display.
segment.target: To manually adjust the size, use an answer file and include settings for Microsoft-Windows-Setup/Display.

segment.source: To learn more, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.
segment.target: To learn more, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.

segment.source: Unmount the Windows PE image and create media
segment.target: Unmount the Windows PE image and create media

segment.source: Unmount the Windows PE image.
segment.target: Unmount the Windows PE image.

segment.source: Create bootable media, such as a USB flash drive.
segment.target: Create bootable media, such as a USB flash drive.

segment.source: Boot the media.
segment.target: Boot the media.

segment.source: Windows PE starts automatically.
segment.target: Windows PE starts automatically.

segment.source: After the Windows PE window appears, the wpeinit command runs automatically.
segment.target: After the Windows PE window appears, the wpeinit command runs automatically.

segment.source: This may take a few minutes.
segment.target: This may take a few minutes.

segment.source: Verify your customizations.
segment.target: Verify your customizations.

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: Windows PE won’t boot?
segment.target: Windows PE won’t boot?

segment.source: See the troubleshooting tips at the end of the topic: Install Windows PE.
segment.target: See the troubleshooting tips at the end of the topic: Install Windows PE.

segment.source: For tips on connecting to a network, see WinPE Network Drivers: Initializing and adding drivers.
segment.target: For tips on connecting to a network, see WinPE Network Drivers: Initializing and adding drivers.
